page.title: 05New Forest-Picnic, Thieves
page.content:
We went to{Hawkhill and Stockley {Inclosures}for the day. The car park has lots of little open areas separated by trees. We went for a walk to the railway. There are many footpaths, some wider tracks and some gravel roads. These make natural breaks in the woodland for{fire {prevention.}We saw other people walking and some cyclists. We saw a man in a pony and trap. When we had finished our walk we had some hamburgers cooked on a gaz burner in the picnic area or car park. While we were out on our walk somebody tried to open the boot of my grandfather's car but they did not manage it. You have to make sure you{lock your car and do not leave anything valuable in it when you are in the Forest.
Jeffrey Corn aged 8.
